product.name: Nikon 18-105 mm f/3.5-5.6 AF-S DX VR ED Nikkor Lens
product.description:
Nikon 18-105mm f/3.5-5.6 AF-S DX VR ED Nikkor Lens
Moderately cheap super zoom, often often found in kits.
Note! There are multiple versions of this lens

Note! There are multiple versions of this lens

product.name: Nikon D70 Camera
product.description:
Nikon D70 DSLR camera.
* Electronic shutter, very high flash sync speed. * Low sensitivity, bad for low light. * 6 Mpix

product.name: Nikon D90 Camera
product.description:
Nikon D90 DSLR camera
* Moderately good in high ISO

product.name: Nikon SB-26 Flash
product.description:
Nikon SB-26 Flash
* Has optical slave capability.

product.name: Tamron AF 17-50mm f/2.8 SP XR Di II LD Aspherical [IF] (Nikon)
product.description:
High quality, but cheap normal zoom. This lens is optically very good, only cromatic aberation is a slight problem. Mechanically the lens is only moderately good. Fast focus speed, because external motor is used.
Note: There is a second version of this lens, with vibration reduction, which is optically slightly inferior.

product.name: Tamron AF 17-50mm f/2.8 SP XR Di II LD Aspherical [IF] VC (Nikon)
product.description:
High quality standard zoom. Fast focus speed, even though internal motor is used. Lens has vibration reduction, which works very well. (4 stops claimed by manufacturer) Optical performance is good, with sharp centers, but blurry corners at the wide end.
Note: There is a second version of this lens, *without* vibration reduction, which is optically better.

product.name: Tokina AF 16-50mm f/2.8 AT-X Pro DX (Nikon)
product.description: High quality normal zoom. Fast focus speed, because external motor is used. Very good build quality. A very similar lens is sold by Pentax (DA* 16-50mm f/2.8), but the Tokina version is not weather protected.
